meanings.definition: To surpass in points or score.
meanings.sent1: She was outpointing her opponent in the game.
meanings.sent2: The team outpointed their rivals in the final match.
meanings.sent3: The cat was outpointing the dog in catching the toy.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to practice was outpointing his natural talent.
meanings.sent5: The student's hard work was outpointing his previous test scores.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform in a competition or comparison.
meanings.sent1: The new model is outpointing the older version in sales.
meanings.sent2: She outpointed all her classmates in the science fair.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outpointing the birds in gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was outpointing his lack of experience.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination was outpointing his initial doubts.
